title: Understanding Scientific Notation
text: Scientific notation is a way of expressing very large or very small numbers. It is written in the form of a number between $$1$$ and $$10$$ multiplied by a power of $$10$$.

title: Identify the Components
text: In the expression $$7.03\times {10}^5$$, identify the two main components: the decimal part $$(7.03)$$ and the power of ten $${10}^5$$.

title: Multiplying by Powers of Ten
text: Multiplying a number by $${10}^5$$ in scientific notation means moving the decimal point to the right by $$5$$ places to convert it to standard notation.

title: Move the Decimal Place
text: Calculate the new number when the decimal point of $$7.03$$ is shifted right by $$5$$ places.

title: Check Your Work
text: Ensure you have moved the decimal point by the correct number of places and filled in any missing zeros if needed.
